lessons.title: Gut Health Foundation
lessons.subtitle: Why gut health is the #1 missing piece in modern medicine

sections.content: Hey {name}! Welcome to your Gut Health Certification journey. You are about to discover why the gut is called the 'second brain' and how understanding it will set you apart in one of the fastest-growing wellness niches in the country. Over 70 million Americans suffer from digestive disorders, and most of them are not getting real answers. That is about to change because of practitioners like you.
What Is Gut Health and Why Does It Matter?

Gut health refers to the function and balance of the entire gastrointestinal tract, from your mouth to your colon. But it goes far beyond digestion. Your gut houses 70 percent of your immune system, produces 95 percent of your serotonin, and contains over 500 million neurons in its own nervous system called the enteric nervous system. When the gut is compromised, the ripple effects touch every system in the body.

The gut is not just a digestive organ. It is a command center for immunity, mood, metabolism, and inflammation. That is why gut health specialists are in such high demand right now. You are not just fixing stomachaches. You are transforming lives.
The Healthcare Gap

The average gastroenterologist visit lasts 15 minutes. Wait times to see one are 3 months or longer. And most conventional approaches focus on symptom suppression with medications like PPIs, antacids, and laxatives rather than addressing root causes. Meanwhile, patients are frustrated, still suffering, and actively searching for someone who will actually listen and help them heal.

62 percent of adults report that their doctor has never asked about their digestive health during a routine visit. This is your opportunity. Gut health specialists fill a gap that the medical system cannot.
Scope of Practice

As an ASI-certified Gut Health Specialist, you work within a clear scope of practice. You do not diagnose diseases, prescribe medications, or replace medical care. Instead, you educate clients on gut health principles, guide them through evidence-based nutrition and lifestyle protocols, help them identify food sensitivities through elimination strategies, and support them in building sustainable habits that promote long-term gut healing.

Scope of Practice: The boundaries within which a certified gut health specialist operates. You educate, guide, and support. You refer out for medical diagnosis, prescription treatment, and acute conditions. Working within scope protects you and builds trust with clients and healthcare providers.
The 5 Root Causes of Gut Dysfunction

Nearly every gut issue your clients present with can be traced back to one or more of these five root causes. Understanding them is what separates a certified specialist from someone who just Googles symptoms.
The 5 root causes you will address as a Gut Health Specialist:
items: Microbiome Imbalance (Dysbiosis): The gut contains trillions of bacteria. When harmful strains outnumber beneficial ones due to antibiotics, processed food, or stress, the entire system breaks down.
Intestinal Permeability (Leaky Gut): When the gut lining becomes damaged, undigested food particles and toxins leak into the bloodstream, triggering systemic inflammation and autoimmune responses.

Digestive Insufficiency: Low stomach acid, inadequate enzyme production, and poor bile flow mean food is not properly broken down, leading to bloating, nutrient deficiencies, and bacterial overgrowth.
Chronic Inflammation: Driven by food sensitivities, environmental toxins, and stress, gut inflammation damages tissue, impairs absorption, and creates a vicious cycle of worsening symptoms.
Nervous System Dysregulation: The gut-brain axis means chronic stress directly shuts down digestive function. Clients stuck in fight-or-flight cannot heal their gut no matter what they eat.

sections.content: Sarah's Story

I spent 8 years going from doctor to doctor. IBS, acid reflux, chronic fatigue, brain fog, anxiety. I was on 4 medications and none of them fixed anything. Then I worked with a gut health specialist who actually looked at root causes. Within 90 days my bloating was gone, my energy came back, and I was off all 4 medications. That experience changed my life so much that I got certified myself. Now I help other women break free from the same cycle. - Sarah M., Certified Gut Health Specialist

items: 70 million Americans have diagnosed digestive disorders
IBS alone affects 25 to 45 million people in the US
The global gut health supplement market will exceed $20 billion by 2027
Autoimmune conditions, most linked to gut health, are rising 7 percent per year
People are spending thousands on supplements with no guidance. They need YOU.

lessons.title: The D.E.P.T.H. Method™
lessons.subtitle: Your systematic framework for gut health transformation

sections.content: Welcome back, {name}! In the last lesson you learned why gut health matters and the five root causes behind most gut dysfunction. Now you are going to learn exactly HOW to work with clients using the D.E.P.T.H. Method, the proprietary framework developed by AccrediPro that turns your knowledge into a repeatable, results-driven process.
Why You Need a Framework

Most new practitioners struggle not because they lack knowledge, but because they lack structure. They know about probiotics, elimination diets, and leaky gut but they do not know where to START with a real client sitting in front of them. The D.E.P.T.H. Method solves this. It gives you a step-by-step system that works for every client, every time.

steps.title: Discover
steps.description: Conduct a comprehensive gut health intake. Map the client's full symptom picture, health history, dietary patterns, stress levels, medication use, and lifestyle factors. Use the AccrediPro Gut Health Assessment to systematically uncover what conventional medicine missed.

steps.title: Evaluate
steps.description: Analyze the intake data against the 5 root causes of gut dysfunction. Identify which root causes are most likely driving symptoms. Look for patterns: Is this primarily a microbiome issue? Digestive insufficiency? Nervous system dysregulation? Most clients have 2-3 root causes interacting.

steps.title: Pinpoint
steps.description: Prioritize the root causes and create a targeted action plan. Address the most upstream issue first. For gut health, this often means starting with the Remove phase: eliminating trigger foods and supporting stress response before layering in supplements and probiotics.

steps.title: Transform
steps.description: Implement the gut healing protocol using the 5R framework: Remove triggers, Replace digestive factors, Reinoculate with beneficial bacteria, Repair the gut lining, and Rebalance lifestyle. Guide the client through each phase with specific food plans, supplement recommendations, and habit changes.

steps.title: Heal
steps.description: Monitor progress, adjust protocols, and build long-term maintenance strategies. Gut healing is not a one-time event. Teach clients to sustain their results through ongoing nutrition, stress management, and microbiome support so they never go back to where they started.

sections.content: D - Discover: The Gut Health Intake

Your intake is the most important session. This is where you gather the data that will drive everything else. A thorough gut health intake covers digestive symptoms and their timing, complete medication and supplement history including antibiotics, diet quality and patterns, stress levels and sleep quality, stool characteristics and frequency, skin conditions, mood issues, and energy levels. Remember, gut dysfunction shows up everywhere, not just in the stomach.

Always ask about antibiotic history. A single course of antibiotics can disrupt the microbiome for months. Many clients can trace the start of their gut issues to a round of antibiotics they took years ago.
E - Evaluate: Pattern Recognition

With your intake data, you now evaluate which root causes are most likely at play. This is where your training sets you apart from someone reading blog posts. You are looking for patterns. Bloating 30 minutes after eating points to low stomach acid. Symptoms that worsen with stress point to nervous system dysregulation. Reactions to multiple foods suggest intestinal permeability. Chronic constipation alternating with diarrhea may indicate dysbiosis or SIBO.
P - Pinpoint: Prioritizing Root Causes

Most clients have multiple root causes. The key is addressing them in the right order. Always work upstream first. If someone has leaky gut, food sensitivities, AND chronic stress, you start with stress management and removing trigger foods. Then you repair the gut lining. Then you reintroduce foods. Trying to heal the gut while the nervous system is in overdrive will not work.
T - Transform: The 5R Protocol in Action
The 5R gut healing protocol you will guide clients through:
items: Remove: Trigger foods, processed foods, inflammatory oils, unnecessary medications, environmental toxins
Replace: Stomach acid support, digestive enzymes, bile salts for fat digestion
Reinoculate: Multi-strain probiotics, fermented foods, prebiotic fiber to feed beneficial bacteria
Repair: L-Glutamine for intestinal cell repair, zinc carnosine, collagen, omega-3 fatty acids
Rebalance: Stress management techniques, sleep optimization, mindful eating practices, movement

sections.content: H - Heal: Long-Term Maintenance

Healing is not just about fixing symptoms. It is about teaching clients to maintain their results for life. In the Heal phase, you transition from active gut repair to maintenance. This includes identifying each client's unique trigger foods to avoid long-term, establishing a sustainable gut-supportive diet, creating a stress management routine, and knowing when to revisit protocols if symptoms return.

Real-world application: A client presents with chronic bloating, brain fog, and anxiety. Using D.E.P.T.H., you Discover that she took antibiotics 4 times last year for recurring UTIs. You Evaluate and identify dysbiosis and likely leaky gut as root causes. You Pinpoint the priority: restore microbiome balance first, then repair gut lining. You Transform using the 5R protocol over 90 days. You Heal by teaching her a maintenance plan with probiotics, prebiotic-rich foods, and stress management. Result: bloating gone, brain fog lifted, anxiety reduced by 80 percent.

questions.question: In the D.E.P.T.H. Method, what does the 'P' stand for?
questions.explanation: P stands for Pinpoint. This is where you prioritize which root causes to address first and create a targeted action plan. Always work upstream, addressing the most foundational issue before layering in additional interventions.

questions.question: Why should you address stress BEFORE starting a gut healing supplement protocol?
options: The nervous system must be regulated for digestion to function
Stress has nothing to do with gut health
Supplements work faster when you are relaxed
questions.explanation: When the nervous system is stuck in fight-or-flight mode, digestive function shuts down. No amount of supplements can overcome a dysregulated nervous system. Addressing stress first creates the foundation for all other gut healing interventions to work.

In the final lesson, you will learn exactly how to get your first gut health clients, set your pricing, and build a practice that generates $5,000 or more per month while doing work that truly changes lives.

Discover gathers comprehensive data, Evaluate identifies root causes, Pinpoint prioritizes the action plan
Transform implements the 5R protocol: Remove, Replace, Reinoculate, Repair, Rebalance
Always work upstream first. Address stress and remove triggers before adding supplements
Heal focuses on long-term maintenance so clients sustain their results for life

lessons.title: How To Get Your First Clients
lessons.subtitle: Build a thriving gut health practice from day one

sections.content: Congratulations, {name}! You now have the gut health knowledge AND the D.E.P.T.H. Method framework to deliver real results. But knowledge without clients is just a hobby. In this final lesson, you will learn the exact strategy to get your first paying clients, set your pricing, and build a gut health practice that generates consistent income.
The Warm Market Strategy

Your first clients are not strangers on the internet. They are people who already know, like, and trust you. This is your warm market, and it is the fastest path to your first paying clients. Think about it: you probably know at least 10 people right now who complain about bloating, acid reflux, IBS, food sensitivities, low energy, or brain fog. Those are your first clients.
Your warm market includes:
items: Friends and family who have mentioned digestive issues
Coworkers who complain about bloating, fatigue, or brain fog
Social media connections who post about health struggles
Members of local community groups, churches, or gyms
Parents from your children's school or activities
Anyone who has ever said 'I have a sensitive stomach' or 'nothing works for me'

sections.content: You do not need a website, business cards, or a social media following to get your first clients. You need one conversation with someone who is already suffering. Start there.
The Conversation Framework

Getting clients is not about being salesy. It is about having genuine conversations and offering real help. When someone mentions a gut-related issue, simply say: 'I actually just completed a certification in gut health. I am taking on a few clients to build my practice. Would you be interested in a free 15-minute assessment to see if I can help?' That is it. No pitch, no pressure. Just an offer to help.
Pricing Your Services

New gut health specialists often undercharge because of imposter syndrome. Here is the reality: people are already spending hundreds on random supplements, doctor copays, and medications that do not work. Your guided protocol saves them money AND gets results.
Recommended pricing structure:
items: Discovery call: Free (15 minutes to assess fit)
Single session: $125 to $200 per hour
90-day gut healing package: $1,500 to $2,500 (best value, best results)
Group program (6-8 participants): $497 to $997 per person
Monthly maintenance: $200 to $400 per month after initial package

sections.content: Always lead with packages over single sessions. Gut healing takes 90 days minimum. A single session cannot deliver the transformation your clients need. When you sell a 90-day package, you commit to their results and they commit to the process.
Your Income Potential

Let us do the math. If you take on just 3 clients per month on a 90-day package at $1,800 each, that is $5,400 per month. As those clients finish and refer others, your practice grows organically. Many gut health specialists reach $8,000 to $15,000 per month within their first year.

sections.content: The Value of Your ASI Certification

Your certification from the AccrediPro Standards Institute is not just a piece of paper. It signals to clients that you have completed rigorous professional training, that you operate within a defined scope of practice, and that you follow evidence-based protocols. In a field full of self-proclaimed experts, your ASI certification is what builds instant trust.
Certified practitioners charge 40 to 60 percent more than uncertified ones and close clients faster. Your ASI certification is a revenue multiplier, not just a credential.
Scope of Practice Reminder

As you start your practice, always remember your scope. You educate on gut health nutrition and lifestyle strategies. You guide clients through elimination diets and the 5R protocol. You support behavior change and habit formation. You refer to medical professionals for diagnosis, testing interpretation, and medication management. Working within scope is not a limitation. It is what makes you trustworthy and protectable.
Your 30-Day Launch Plan
Follow this plan to get your first clients within 30 days:
items: Week 1: Make a list of 20 people in your warm market who have gut health issues. Reach out to 5 of them with your free assessment offer.
Week 2: Conduct free 15-minute assessments. Offer your 90-day package to anyone who is a good fit.
Week 3: Post 3 times on social media about what you learned in this certification. Share one gut health tip that gets people asking questions.
Week 4: Follow up with everyone you spoke to. Ask for referrals from anyone who said yes. Book your first paying clients.

sections.content: I was terrified to charge for my services. Who was I to call myself a specialist? Then my first client's bloating disappeared in 3 weeks. Her acid reflux was gone in 6 weeks. She cried on our final call and said I changed her life. That is when I knew: this certification gave me everything I needed. I just had to start. - Sarah M., Gut Health Specialist

You have completed all three lessons of your Gut Health Foundation training. Take the certification exam to earn your ASI-accredited credential and officially launch your gut health practice. The exam covers key concepts from all three lessons and most students complete it in under 15 minutes.

You have the knowledge, the framework, and the strategy. The only thing left is to start. Take the exam, get certified, and reach out to your first 5 warm market contacts this week. Your future clients are already waiting for you.
